key_channel_insights.line_content: Parity peaked at 71.7% (+5.8 ppts WoW), yet undercutting tripled to 9.0%, opening new revenue-dilution pockets.
Overall parity is a strong 78%, but 47% of long-haul itineraries price lower on MSE, signalling a material leakage hotspot.
Parity improved to 52%, however 47% of fares remain higher—especially 63% of >21-day bookings—keeping GDS the costliest channel.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Exact-match pricing reached 71.7% of tracked itineraries, up 5.8 ppts WoW and flat MoM.
Fares above the website fell to 18.2% (-11.7 ppts WoW); premium trimmed to +9%.
OTA undercuts nearly tripled to 9.0% (+5.7 ppts), requiring rapid intervention.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Only 1.1% of queries lacked an OTA offer—minimal risk.
Parity at 71.7% is the strongest in five weeks (+6 ppts WoW).
Overpricing shrank to 18.2%; when present, average premium is +9%.
Undercutting rose to 9.0% with an 8% average discount.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Excellent 94.2% parity; rare overpricing (3.9%) carries a +13% premium.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 75.1% parity; overpricing down to 16.1%, but undercuts up to 8.4%.
Parity lags at 59.1%; 26.2% of routes still carry +6% OTA premiums.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Parity 78.1% (+13 ppts); overpricing 16.2%, underpricing low at 5.1%.

mse_highlights.line_content: 78% of MSE observations match the website, +2.5 ppts WoW.
Higher-priced cases fell to 16.6% with a negligible +0.10% gap.
47% of long-haul itineraries are cheaper on MSE (-0.19% gap).

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Only 0.13% of searches lacked an AC offer—near-perfect presence.
16.6% overpriced; premium flat at +0.10% and declining in frequency.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Parity drops to 53%; 47% lower-price frequency despite small gap.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 85% parity; premiums 14% and falling, undercuts just 1%.
Parity 54%; pricing volatile with 27% higher and 19% lower fares.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Parity 79.6% (+5.9 ppts); premiums down to 14.9%, undercuts 5.4%.
Parity softens to 75.9% (-4.6 ppts); premiums rise to 20.1%.

gds_highlights.line_content: Same-fare occurrences climbed to 52% (+11 ppts WoW).
63% of >21-day bookings priced above site with 0.36% premium.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Parity now 52.1% (+11 ppts WoW, +7.6 ppts MoM).
47.2% still carry a premium; share down 10.7 ppts with 0.28% gap.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Parity 74%; only 26% higher with minimal 0.08% premium.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 49% higher pricing with 0.32% premium—worst segment despite improvement.
Parity 58%; premium down to 0.07%, best-aligned origin group.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Overpricing 62.8% dominates; premium 0.36% and stubbornly flat.
